column.name: CONTRACT_NUMBER
column.comment: This column is the unique ID for the LEGAL AGREEMENT, and is necessary for business purposes.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: This column stores the date on which the Order Form is effective. This date can be either the current date, or it can be future dated.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_STATUS
column.comment: This attribute is the state of the object. This can either be active or deactive.

column.name: NOTICE_PERIOD_EXEMPT_INDICATOR
column.comment: Indicates whether the Contract is exempt from a notice period before ending the Contract.

column.name: STATE_RD
column.comment: This column`s data identifies the current state (status) of the object.

column.name: CURRENCY_RD
column.comment: This column defines the Currency which the Contract specifies as the currency to be used as payment.

column.name: VERSION_NUMBER
column.comment: A system generated number identifying the particular version of the LEGAL AGREEMENT.

column.name: LANGUAGE_RD
column.comment: Language identifies the language in which a document is produced.

column.name: LOI_INDICATOR
column.comment: Letter Of Intent Indicator.

column.name: ON_HOLD_INDICATOR
column.comment: The on hold attribute permits the user to move the LEGAL AGREEMENT to a status of "on hold" from both the Created state and the Approved state.

column.name: STATE_DATE
column.comment: The date that the Contract last changed state.

column.name: BOARD_SIGN_NAME
column.comment: The board signature name is the name of the person within the telecom company, who agreed to the LEGAL AGREEMENT.

column.name: BOARD_SIGN_DATE
column.comment: The board signature date identifies the day on which the telecom company signed the LEGAL AGREEMENT.

column.name: PRIMARY_CUST_SIGN_NAME
column.comment: The primary CUSTOMER signature name identifies the primary CUSTOMER who agreed to the LEGAL AGREEMENT. The primary CUSTOMER signature name is required.

column.name: SECONDARY_CUST_SIGN_NAME
column.comment: The secondary CUSTOMER signature name identifies the secondary CUSTOMER who agreed to the LEGAL AGREEMENT.The secondary CUSTOMER signature name identifies the secondary CUSTOMER who agreed to the LEGAL AGREEMENT.

column.name: PRIMARY_CUST_SIGN_DATE
column.comment: The primary CUSTOMER signature date specifies when the primary CUSTOMER agreed to the LEGAL AGREEMENT. The primary CUSTOMER signature date is required.

column.name: SECONDARY_CUST_SIGN_DATE
column.comment: The secondary CUSTOMER signature date specifies when the secondary CUS TOMER agreed to the LEGAL AGREEMENT. The secondary CUSTOMER signature date is optional and allows for situations where two persons are signing the LEGAL AGREEMENT

column.name: GRACE_PERIOD_DUR_VALUE
column.comment: This column defines the duration of the Grace Period. The Grace Period may be used on a fixed term CONTRACT, meaning that no Term Extent Duration or Minimum Contract Period Duration can be defined.

column.name: GRACE_PERIOD_DUR_UNIT_RD
column.comment: This column stores data which defines the duration unit of the Grace Period Duration attribute.

column.name: NOTICE_PERIOD_DUR_VALUE
column.comment: This attribute, together with the noticePeriodDurationUnit attribute, identifies the minimal time for giving a notice to terminate a CONTRAC T.

column.name: NOTICE_PERIOD_DUR_UNIT_RD
column.comment: The unit of duration for the Period of Notice (weeks, months, years).

column.name: NOTICE_PERIOD_START_DATE
column.comment: This attribute identifies the Minimum CONTRACT Period Start Date.

column.name: TERM_DUR_UNIT_RD
column.comment: The unit used to specify the duration of the term (months, years).

column.name: TERM_DUR_VALUE
column.comment: This column, together with the term DurationUnit attribute, identifies the duration of the LEGAL AGREEMENT.

column.name: TERM_EXTENT_DUR_VALUE
column.comment: Term Extent Duration is the length of time the product contract is automatically extended when the termination date is reached and the contract has not been manually terminated.

column.name: TERM_EXTENT_DUR_UNIT_RD
column.comment: This attribute states the unit used to specify the duration of the Term Extent.

column.name: TERM_START_DATE
column.comment: This column identifies the start of the LEGAL AGREEMENT.

column.name: MIN_PERIOD_START_DATE
column.comment: Only applies to open ended contracts, start date of the minimum period duration for the Order Form.

column.name: TERMINATION_DATE
column.comment: This column states the date of Termination for the ORDER FORM.

column.name: MIN_PERIOD_DUR_VALUE
column.comment: This attribute identifies the Minimum CONTRACT Period Duration (in months). The CUSTOMER cannot break the CONTRACT until the end of this period.

column.name: MIN_PERIOD_DUR_UNIT_RD
column.comment: The unit of duration used to define the minimum contract period

column.name: MONTHLY_ORDER_ENTRY_AMOUNT
column.comment: Estimated sum of money in Euros, for a single month generated from the Product Commitment.

column.name: TERMINATION_RESTRICTION_RD
column.comment: Restriction condition when a Product Commitment may be terminated.

column.name: DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE_NAME
column.comment: Name of the document template associated to the Order Form Contract.

column.name: ASSOC_SKELETON_CONTRACT_NUMBER
column.comment: Contract number of the associated Skeleton Contract.

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_USER_ID
column.comment: Audit information capturing user id of last update

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_DATE_TIME
column.comment: Audit information capturing date and time of last update

column.name: UPDATE_NUMBER
column.comment: Version number of the row. The version number starts with a random number and is incremented on each update. Update and Delete operations verify that the number in the database is equal to the number used in the SQL statement (optimistic locking).

column.name: EFFECTIVE_FLAG
column.comment: Flagging of entries accordigng to EFFECTIVE_DATE maintained by source system (EFFONL). "N" (now) - currently valid entry, "P" (past) - entry that was vaild somethen in the past, "F" (future) - entrtry will be valid in the future.

column.name: BATCH_TERMINATION_INDICATOR
column.comment: BATCH_TERMINATION_INDICATOR indicates whether the contract batch termination will be processed. It will be set to N after processing batch termination or when a TERMINATE STP is cancelled or fails.

column.name: TERMINATION_REASON_RD
column.comment: TERMINATION_REASON_RD indicates the reason of termination.

column.name: PENDING_FIF_TRANSACTION_ID
column.comment: ID of open FIF transaction.

column.name: AUTO_EXTENT_DUR_VALUE
column.comment: Interval for automatic contract prolongation.

column.name: AUTO_EXTENT_DUR_UNIT_RD
column.comment: Interval for automatic contract prolongation.

column.name: AUTO_EXTENSION_IND
column.comment: Y if this contract is prolongated automatically.

column.name: AUTO_EXTENT_RESET_DATE
column.comment: System internal date, only relevant for CCM GUI.

column.name: NAME
column.comment: Optional name of the contract.

column.name: SPECIAL_TERMINATION_RIGHT_RD
column.comment: Eligibility to cancel a contract immediately

column.name: CUSTOMER_TRACKING_ID
column.comment: This column stores an identification number, supplied by the CUSTOMER used to reference the CUSTOMER ORDER.

column.name: CHANGE_TYPE
column.comment: Data warehouse entry last action type: "I"-Inserted, "U"-Updated, "D"-Deleted.

column.name: LOADTM
column.comment: Datawarehouse entry change date timestamp (Original name in the DWHDB "_LOADTM")

column.name: FILLER
column.comment: N/A
